result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas S Schneider was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant must sign medical release for agent to have access to doctor and pharmacy records.  Agent must approve all prescriptions.  Defendant must attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: Must participate in ZCI program.  Once complete, balance is stayed.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time, employment, full-time school or combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider and approval of agent.  Submit to random testing as required by agent. Attend 7 self-help groups per week such as AA, NA or comparable.
Comply with all rules and regulations of agent.  Pay all outstanding court obligations.

records.addlTxt: DOC-Notice of Case Status change - revoked - sentenced to prison.
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served(not sent to prison-cfts)

Defendant Nicholas S Schneider in court with attorney Gregory Austin Holdahl.  Defendant Nicholas S Schneider in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.  
There are 3 yrs available.  State is requesting revocation of 2 yrs WPS, 1 yr ES.  Defense requesting 15 mos WPS 2 yrs ES.  Per atty,  has 340 days credit.    State's recommendation exceeds maximums; revised to 18 mos WPS, 2 yrs ES.
BTC:  1 yr 1 day WPS,  2 yrs ES
no alc, cont sub or Rx except by prescribed   No addictive medications without prior approval of agent  (Xanax, oxy, percoset, valium or like substances)  Random testing.  7 self-help groups per week, AA, NA or similar   School/work = ft.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 03-15-2016 10:00 am
Per RASO - mandatory jail time has been served
Defendant is undecided about seeking postconviction relief.
To consolidate with 14FO648
Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
NG plea entered.
Reading waived.

Defendant Nicholas S Schneider in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Nicholas S Schneider in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for Jennifer Tanck-Adams for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Nicholas S Schneider in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Nicholas S Schneider in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.    Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
